title: Kerala Fish Curry
instructions: Marinate fish with turmeric and salt for 15 minutes.
Heat coconut oil, add onions and sauté until golden.
Add tomatoes and cook until mushy.
Add spice powders and cook until oil separates.
Add coconut milk and bring to gentle boil.
Add fish pieces and cook until fish is tender.
Garnish with curry leaves and serve hot.

title: Appam (Kerala Rice Pancakes)
instructions: Soak raw rice for 4 hours, drain and grind with cooked rice.
Mix yeast with sugar and warm water, let it froth.
Add yeast mixture to rice batter, mix well.
Add coconut milk and salt, mix to smooth consistency.
Let batter ferment for 6-8 hours.
Heat appam pan, pour batter and swirl to spread evenly.
Cover and cook until edges are crispy and center is soft.

title: Kerala Chicken Curry
instructions: Marinate chicken with turmeric, salt, and half the spice powders.
Heat coconut oil, add onions and sauté until golden.
Add tomatoes and cook until mushy.
Add remaining spice powders and cook until oil separates.
Add marinated chicken and cook covered until tender.
Add coconut milk and simmer for 5 minutes.
Garnish with curry leaves and serve hot.

title: Puttu (Steamed Rice Cakes)
instructions: Mix rice flour with salt and water to make crumbly mixture.
Layer grated coconut and rice flour mixture in puttu maker.
Steam for 10-12 minutes until cooked.
Serve hot with kadala curry or banana.
Can also serve with sugar and coconut.

title: Kerala Sambar
ingredients: For tempering: coconut oil, mustard seeds, fenugreek seeds, dried red chilies, curry leaves
instructions: Cook toor dal until soft and mash it well.
Cook mixed vegetables until tender.
Add tamarind pulp, sambar powder, turmeric, and salt.
Add mashed dal and mix well. Simmer for 10 minutes.
Heat coconut oil for tempering, add all tempering ingredients.
Pour tempering over sambar and serve hot.
